Package me.mayhem.input

Class InputListener<T extends org.jsfml.window.event.Event>

java.lang.Object
me.mayhem.input.InputListener<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractKeyboardMouseInteractable, GainedFocusListener, KeyboardInputListener, KeyboardPressListener, KeyboardReleaseListener, LostFocusListener, MouseButtonListener, MouseButtonPressListener, MouseButtonReleaseListener, MouseEnteredListener, MouseInputListener, MouseLeftListener, MouseMovementListener, MouseWheelListener
public abstract class InputListener<T extends org.jsfml.window.event.Event>
extends java.lang.Object
InputListener is an abstract class used to redirect from the JSFML events handled in the main loop in the Mayhem class to the sub-classes for things such as buttons and entities in the world InputListener automatically registers itself with the InputManager upon initialization. This removes the dependency of InputManager from the other classes in the event of finding a more efficient, simplistic, or elegant way of handling all the subsequent listeners InputListener can be extended directly for those confident. However, there are sub-classes for each of the possible JSFML input events that can be extended to remove the complexity of the generics and Event.Type combination created by JSFML.

    Default constructor taking varargs of all the types that it needs to listen to

    void register()
    Registers the listener with the InputManager - called in the constructor
    protected abstract void takeInput​(T event)
    Sub-class protected, abstract method used to handle the specific event once it has been determined this listener is correct for that type of event
    void unregister()
    Unregisters the listener with the InputManager
